meanings.definition: A device for making and breaking the connection in an electric circuit.
meanings.sent1: I turned on the switch to light up the room.
meanings.sent2: The switch on the wall controls the ceiling fan.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat kept flicking the switch on and off.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a switch, instantly brightening the room.
meanings.sent5: The switch clicked loudly as it was flipped.

meanings.sent1: The switch from summer to fall brought cooler weather.
meanings.sent2: They made a switch in their seating arrangement.
meanings.sent3: The sudden switch in plans caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: His mood made a switch from happy to sad in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The switch in leadership led to new ideas and perspectives.

meanings.definition: To change the position, direction, or focus of.
meanings.sent1: She had to switch seats with her friend to see the screen better.
meanings.sent2: I will switch the light to face the painting on the wall.
meanings.sent3: He tried to switch the conversation topic to avoid an awkward silence.
meanings.sent4: The dancer switched effortlessly from one move to the next.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to switch partners for the activity.
